field.label: Enable
field.help: This will activate the Collectd service.

field.label: Hostname
field.help: Set the hostname for this system.

field.label: FQDN lookup
field.help: If the hostname is determined automatically this setting controls whether or not the daemon should try to figure out the fully qualified domain name (FQDN). This is done by looking up the name by using gethostname.

field.label: Interval
field.help: Global interval when to fetch values in seconds.

field.label: Enable network plugin
field.help: The Network plugin can send values to other instances

field.label: Network collector host
field.help: Set the IP address or FQDN of the network collector.

field.label: Network collector port
field.help: Set the port of the network collector. Collectd is using 25826 per default.

field.label: Network collector username
field.help: Set the username to authenticate against network collector (optional).

field.label: Network collector password
field.help: Set the password to authenticate against network collector (optional).

field.label: Network collector encryption
field.help: Enable encryption for authentication against network collector (optional).

field.label: Enable graphite plugin
field.help: The Graphite plugin stores values in Carbon, the storage layer of Graphite.

field.label: Graphite collector node name
field.help: Set the name of the graphite collector.

field.label: Graphite collector host
field.help: Set the IP address of the graphite collector.

field.label: Graphite collector port
field.help: Set the port of the graphite collector, Graphite is using 2003 per default.

field.label: Enable contextswitch plugin
field.help: The ContextSwitch plugin collects the number of context switches done by the operating system.

field.label: Enable cpu plugin
field.help: The CPU plugin collects the amount of time spent by the CPU in various states, most notably executing user code, executing system code, waiting for IO-operations and being idle.

field.label: Enable df plugin
field.help: The DF plugin collects file system usage information, i. e. basically how much space on a mounted partition is used and how much is available.

field.label: Enable interface plugin
field.help: The Interface plugin collects information about the traffic, packets per second and errors of interfaces.

field.label: Enable load plugin
field.help: The Load plugin collects the system load.

field.label: Enable memory plugin
field.help: The Memory plugin collects physical memory utilization (Used, buffered, cached and free).

field.label: Enable processes plugin
field.help: The Processes plugin collects the number of processes, grouped by their state (e. g. running, sleeping, zombies, etc.).

field.label: Enable uptime plugin
field.help: The Uptime plugin keeps track of the system uptime, providing informations such as the average running time or the maximum reached uptime over a certain period of time.

field.label: Enable users plugin
field.help: The Users plugin counts the number of users currently logged into the system (SSH).
